summary: This is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel discussing the unsealing of court documents related to Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest. It references media reporter Tom Winter obtaining information from an FBI source ahead of the official release.

persons.name: Tom Winter
persons.context: NBC reporter mentioned as having a great source at the FBI who provided information about Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest before the official unsealing.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the arrest and unsealing order discussed in the email chain.

persons.name: Parker
persons.context: Mentioned as the person expected to sign the unsealing order for the Maxwell case documents.

connections.description: Tom Winter is described as having 'some great source at FBI' who provided him with information about Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest.

events.title: Unsealing Order for Maxwell Case
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office discusses receiving and awaiting the signing of an unsealing order for court documents related to Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest.

events.title: Media Reports on Maxwell Arrest
events.description: NBC reporter Tom Winter publishes a story about Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest, reportedly based on information from an FBI source, before the official unsealing.

keyFacts: The email chain reveals internal frustration within the U.S. Attorney's Office about media obtaining information on Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest before official unsealing.
Reporter Tom Winter is identified as having a source within the FBI who leaked case information.
The correspondence confirms an active process to unseal court documents related to Maxwell's arrest on July 2, 2020.
The tone suggests urgency and concern about controlling the release of information to the public.
